elements.title: Armadale Capital Plc Strategic Report Final Results 2022 - Operational and Corporate Highlights

data.value: In February 2022, the Company applied for three incremental exploration licences to enhance the Mahenge Liandu Graphite Project's exploration potential.

In March 2022, a weather station was installed to collect data (temperature, pressure, wind, moon phase, humidity, solar radiation, rainfall) at 5-second intervals; data is automatically uploaded to the cloud for mining operations planning.
Installed 7 stream gauges and one barotroll in March 2022 at the mine site to record temperature, pressure, and depth data at 5-second intervals; data is manually downloaded monthly.
Cleared pads for geotechnical drilling as part of the ongoing FEED study, with 10 pads cleared at the tailing storage facility and 6 at the proposed plant site.
A test pit program was completed with 41 pits excavated (11 at the plant site, 25 at the tailings area, and 5 along the access road), including DCP testing, strata logging, sampling, and backfilling.
The prospecting license PL 119961/2022 was granted on 28 June 2022 for graphite mineral exploration over 19.99 square kilometres in Ulanga District, Morogoro Region.
The Company focused on securing project development funding, progressing discussions with potential finance partners.

elements.title: Accounting Policies: Taxation and Exploration Costs

data.value: Deferred tax assets and liabilities are measured at expected tax rates based on enacted laws and are offset when there is a legally enforceable right.
Current and deferred tax are recognized as expense or income in profit or loss, except when related items are recognized outside profit or loss.

Costs incurred following an exploration licence are capitalized on a project-by-project basis, including technical, administrative expenses, and a pro-rata share of finance costs (excluding general overheads).
If a mining property project is successful, related expenditures are amortised over the life of the commercial ore reserves on a unit of production basis.
Costs are written off if a licence is relinquished, a project is abandoned, or is deemed to have no commercial value.
Deferred exploration and development costs are reclassified as development and production assets within property, plant and equipment upon development of commercial reserves.

elements.title: Armadale Capital Plc Strategic Report (Continued)

data.value: Directors consider continuing active work on the Mahenge Liandu Graphite Project in the best interest of contractor employees, ensuring skills utilization and community development. Regular feedback from key stakeholders, including staff and advisers, is actively sought to maintain an ethical corporate culture.

Directors ensure supplier availability and commitment through periodic and ad-hoc briefings. Effective communication with staff and other stakeholders, including shareholders, is maintained via regulatory news releases, updated investor relations, and reports.

The Company engages with communities through employment and business development arrangements. It adheres to environmental and social management plans on the Mahenge Liandu Graphite Project, utilizing a local manager in Liandu to manage local affairs and feedback.

The board has a collective responsibility for maintaining high standards of business conduct. They define corporate governance frameworks, set strategic goals, and ensure adherence to ethical values throughout all dealings.
